channel.title: Docs on COLA-Lab@Exeter
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on COLA-Lab@Exeter

item.description: Members # .grid-container { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 15% 35% 15% 35%; grid-gap: 15px; background-color: transparent; padding: 5px; align-content: left; } Faculty # Dr Ke Li UKRI FLF Principal Investigator University of Exeter Research Staff(s) # Dr Jiangjiao Xu Research Fellow 07/2020 – present Interests: smart grid, TL, EMO, meta learning PhD Student(s) # Joseph Billingsly

Vacancies # We very much welcome and support applications from underrepresented groups and from people of all shapes, shades, and genders. If you are uncertain about your possible role in our team, please do not hesitate to get in touch with Ke Li. PhD There are multiple opportunities available at the University of Exeter to fund your PhD study. China Scholarship Council (Chinese Students): The University of Exeter is proud to offer up to 15 full-time PhD scholarships in collaboration with the China Scholarship Council (CSC).

Grants # We are grateful to have been generously supported by or closely working with the following funding bodies and industrial partners. Ongoing EPSRC DTP Doctoral Prize: #***, Knowledge Representation in Transfer Optimisation System and Applications for Highly Configurable Software Systems, PI, £74,000, 2020-2024. UKRI Future Leaders Fellowship: #MR/S017062/1, Transfer Optimisation System for Adaptive Automated Nature-Inspired Optimisation, PI, £1,370,803 (UKRI Contribution: £1,096,643), 2019–2023. EPSRC/British Telecommunications Industrial CASE Studentship: #EP/P51049X/1, Dynamic Resource Management and Optimization for SLA Guarantees in Hyperconverged Communication Infrastructures, Co-I (with PI: Prof.

Publications # hr.dashed { border-top: 1px dashed #bbb; } .grid-container { display: grid; grid-template-columns: 40% 60%; grid-gap: 5px; background-color: transparent; padding: 5px; } The copyrights of published papers are transferred to publishers. Misuse of any material posted here may result in plagiarism. means equal contribution. + means student under my supervision. * means equal contribution View by year # .... 2020 2019 2018 2017 2016 2015 2014 2013 2012 2011 2010 2009 Featured publications # MOEA/D: decomposition-based EMO MCDM: preference learning and decision-making CO: constrained optimization SE: software engineering MOEA/D Stable Matching Based Selection in Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization
